summaries.body: Chipotle said it planned to hire 4,000 workers nationwide in a single day next month. So-called fast-casual restaurants like Chipotle have been booming.

display_asset.caption: Justin Wilson was injured during Sunday's race and airlifted to the hospital.

summaries.body: Justin Wilson, the IndyCar driver, was in a coma in critical condition after sustaining a head injury in a crash-filled race at Pocono Raceway.
NASA’s Cassini spacecraft has made its final flyby of Dione, the fourth largest of Saturn’s more than 60 moons, delighting astronomers with new detailed images.

display_asset.caption: Senior Trooper Steven J. Vincent
display_asset.credit: Louisiana State Police, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Louisiana state trooper died Monday after being shot in the head a day earlier during a traffic stop. Passing motorists helped to apprehend the suspected gunman.

display_asset.credit: The Canadian Press, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The fallout continues from a data breach of Ashley Madison, the adultery website, as international authorities search for the hackers.

display_asset.caption: The second of two newborn giant pandas is cared for by members of the panda team.

summaries.body: Raising healthy panda cub twins will be a singular problem for the National Zoo's mother panda, Mei Xiang: Only two other bears have successfully done so in captivity.
Hard on the heels of his retirement from “The Daily Show,” Jon Stewart hosted World Wrestling Entertainment’s 28th annual SummerSlam on Sunday. He also threw a chair.
Why being the unanimous pick for the No. 1 team in college football in the preseason is bad news for Ohio State.

display_asset.caption: Stephen Colbert's inaugural "Late Show" guest list includes film, TV and music stars, as well as  figures from the worlds of politics, business and literature.

summaries.body: Stephen Colbert, the new host of CBS’s “The Late Show,” unveiled the roster of his first week of guests, and it included more than TV and movie stars.
On Saturday, the rapper Wiz Khalifa, above, was forced to the ground and arrested at the Los Angeles International Airport during a confrontation involving a hoverboard.

display_asset.caption: In downtown Beirut, Lebanon, the garbage crisis took a violent turn on Sunday when protesters and the police clashed.
display_asset.title: Protesters and Police Clash in Lebanon

summaries.body: Protesters and the police clashed on Sunday night in downtown Beirut, as Lebanon's long-running garbage crisis took a violent turn.

posts.footer: The toll continues to rise after a fighter jet taking part in a British airshow on Saturday crashed into a highway, via Twitter

summaries.body: Final death toll from Shoreham air crash could rise to 20, Sussex Police say http://t.co/IJllJv91Ky
Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan will not attend China's military parade on Sept. 3 to commemorate the end of World War II, a government spokesman said on Monday.
On Monday, Prime Minister Tony Abbott became the first leader of Australia to visit the grave of the indigenous land rights campaigner Eddie Koiki Mabo.
Hong Xudong, a Chinese man who was kidnapped while cycling through Pakistan in 2014, has been freed by the security forces, according to the Pakistani government.

display_asset.caption: Usain Bolt of Jamaica won the men’s 100 meters at the world championships in Beijing on Sunday, edging out the American Justin Gatlin, left.

summaries.body: Usain Bolt of Jamaica, above, third from left, won the men’s 100 meters at the world championships in Beijing on Sunday, edging out the American Justin Gatlin.

display_asset.credit: Mark Makela for The New York Times

summaries.body: New rules to speed up play in minor league baseball have been in effect for more than three months and are beginning to shave several minutes off games.
The people sought in the bombing at a Bangkok shrine last week "may have already fled” the country, Thailand's chief of police said on Sunday.
Mass graves with 24 bodies, believed to be those of migrants, have been found in the Malaysian state of Perlis, near the border of Thailand, police say.
U Shwe Maung, an elected lawmaker and member of Myanmar’s governing party, was told he was not a citizen and was unable to run for office because he is Rohingya.
Nepal has opened Mount Everest to climbers for the first time since an earthquake caused an avalanche in April, killing 19 mountaineers.

display_asset.caption: A Black Lives Matter demonstration in Atlanta in December.

summaries.body: A prominent Black Lives Matter activist was forced to discuss deeply personal issues after he was accused of lying about his race. The controversy has become a proxy for a wider culture war over race and policing.
First Lt. Shaye Haver and Capt. Kristen Griest became the first women to graduate from the Army's elite Ranger School at a ceremony on Friday.

display_asset.caption: Donald Trump "has enough color for the whole group," the Bad Lip Reader says of the Republican presidential candidate and his competitors.

summaries.body: The producer behind the viral video series "Bad Lip Reading" discusses the 2016 presidential candidates: "Trump has enough color for the whole group."
The riot police in Macedonia fired tear gas to disperse thousands of migrants and refugees trying to enter the Balkan country from Greece.
Jeremy Corbyn said that he would formally apologize on behalf of the Labour Party for taking Britain to war with Iraq if he were elected as head of the party.
Israel fired missiles against more than a dozen Syrian posts after four rockets were fired from Syrian territory.
The U.N. said sexual abuse allegations against its peacekeepers in the Central African Republic involved children as young as 11.
Two small planes collided over western Slovakia, killing seven people, while 31 were able to parachute to safety.
The British Embassy in Tehran will reopen, officials said, in a significant indication of warming Western relations with Iran after a deal limiting its nuclear program.
